Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> On 2/2/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>  >
>  >
>  > >    - Can break when refactoring
>  >
>  > That's why we have tests.
> 
> No, that's why we have static typing.

The static type checker generates a bunch of tests, 99% of which always 
pass.

> Besides, *you* have tests.  Not everybody does.

Not everybody is on this list. I didn't have everybody in mind when I 
asked the question. Even strong TDD practitioners seem to find Pluggable 
Selector dangerous. It seems a prevalent attitude; that's why I asked.

> If I have to choose between "tests" and "tests and static typing", I will
> pick the latter any day.

I prefer to lose the training wheels. Agree to disagree. I'll buy the 
next beer.
